abstract: American Express chief executive Kenneth I Chenault says company will ask for stay of Federal Judge Nicholas G Garaufis's ruling that company could not prohibit merchants from recommending that customers use lower-cost cards; practice has long been used by Amex, which charges merchants higher fees than competitors Visa or Mastercard, and was determined to violate antitrust laws.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge had ruled the credit card company’s practice of banning retailers from encouraging customers to use lower-cost options violated antitrust laws.

headline.main: Amex to Ask for Stay of Ruling Prohibiting Merchants From Promoting Other Cards
headline.print_headline: Amex to Ask for a Stay of Antitrust Decision

snippet: A federal judge had ruled the credit card company’s practice of banning retailers from encouraging customers to use lower-cost options violated antitrust laws.
